title: Plant Supervisor
description:
Sewaren, NJ
  
  

PSC Group is looking for a high-potential, servant leader to mentor, coach, and inspire our PSC employees in a chemical plant or refinery in the Sewaren, NJ area. This position has upward mobility to grow within our company in the petrochemical industry. The ideal candidate must have experience in leading (supervising / managing) teams (industry experience is a plus). This individual must also be highly self-motivated and will build trust and open communication to continue our mission to be the best at what we do.
  
  

The overall guiding expectation is that the supervisor will actively engage with our customer's site leader(s) and PSC field employees to ensure that all operations under his or her direction are striving to achieve excellent performance in the areas of safety, environmental and overall job quality.
  
  

**Work Schedule:** Monday through Friday day shift (subject to change)
  
  

**Duties & Responsibilities:**  

Overall Operating Performance
  
  

* Ensures systems and processes are in place to drive safety and environmental performance by the workgroup.
* Clearly communicates goals around operating performance and ensures positive recognition is occurring for good performance.
* Models appropriate behavior in safety meetings, field observations, and training initiatives.
* Ensures conformance to GMP as defined by Procedures and Policies at site (when applicable)
* Completes any other duties that may be assigned to complete the job.


Leadership Development
  
  

* Develops employees through servant leadership, coaching, and mentoring.
* Works closely with Operations Manager to identify future leaders and creates individual development plans.


Employee / Customer Relationships
  
  

* Fosters relationships with key customer leaders through frequent interaction and communication.
* Builds trust with employees by ensuring open lines of communication and transparency.


**Job Qualifications:**  

* Experience in leading (supervising / managing) teams
* Industry experience is a plus
* Must have the ability to obtain a TWIC and have a valid driver's license
* Must possess a valid TWIC card & driver's license
* 18 years or older and legally able to work in the U.S.
* Stable work history with good references from past employers
* Pass a drug screen, physical, and background check
* PSC is a veteran-friendly company. Previous military experience and proven ability to follow procedures a plus.


Why join the PSC team?
  
  

* Founded in 1952, PSC' s longevity is rooted in our commitment to quality service, safety, environmental protection, and taking good care of our employees.
* PSC is the industry leader in product handling and site logistics services for refineries, chemical producers, and marine transportation providers.
* Check out our videos at PSC Group - Career Videos to see how the work we do makes a difference and is essential for our economy.
* Learn more about our company culture and view our PSC Connection employee newsletter at PSC Group - Newsletter
* Our Core Values serve as the foundation for all we do—how we conduct our business, serve our customers, and treat members of our PSC family. Learn more at PSC Group - Core Values


**Employee Benefits:**  

* Medical insurance options with the company paying a large portion of the premiums, including affordable dental and vision plans for employees and their families
* Company-paid life, short-term, and long-term disability insurance
* Matching 401(k) plan to help employees save money for retirement
* Vacation, sick leave, and holiday benefits (varies by work group)
* Incentives, discounts, and bonuses
* Industry-leading training and development programs


**Physical Requirements:****You must be able to:**  

* Speak, write, read fluent English. Hear and have good vision.
* Regular on-site attendance and punctuality is required
* Work outside in environmental conditions which at times include extreme heat or extreme cold
* Wear all required Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) without restriction and pass any medical examination associated with the use of PPE


To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily with or without reasonable accommodations. The requirements listed above are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required.
  
  

This job description should not be construed as an exhaustive statement of duties, responsibilities or requirements, but a general description of the job. Nothing contained herein restricts the company's rights to assign or reassign duties and responsibilities to this job at any time.
  
  

PSC Group, formerly known as Petroleum Service Corporation, is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religion, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, age, or any other characteristic protected by law.

title: English Language Arts Lab Teacher
description:
**Position Title: English Teacher-Lab Teacher (High School) Summary:**

Under the general supervision of the School Director, to develop students' skills in listening, speaking, reading, and writing, foster communication skills, develop an understanding and appreciation of literature of all types, motivate students to read a wide variety of publications to derive information, comprehend and critically assess the reading materials, and to promote the development of skills in the field of English reading, grammar and syntax.

**Qualifications:**

* Bachelor’s degree from an accredited college or university is required.
* New Jersey Standard Teaching Certification (CE,CEAS) with subject matter specialization: English Language Arts
* Motor Vehicle Operator’s License or ability to provide own transportation.
* Demonstrate the ability to effectively communicate orally and in writing, using proper grammar and vocabulary.
* Knowledge of applicable federal and state laws regarding education and students.
* Ability to engage in self-evaluation with regard to performance and professional growth.
* Knowledge of current teaching methods and educational pedagogy, as well as differentiated instruction based upon student learning styles.
* Knowledge of grade specific school curriculum and concepts, including all subject matters taught.
* Understand the requirement to maintain confidentiality concerning charter school related matters.
* Ability to establish and maintain cooperative working relationships with others contacted in the course of work; parents, students and faculty etc.
* **Prior to employment, the following must be addressed:**
* Required to complete a criminal history background check to prove that the individual has not been convicted of a crime or a disorderly person’s offense in accordance with N.J.S.A 18A:6-7.1.
* Provide evidence that health is adequate to fulfill the job functions and responsibilities with reasonable accommodation pursuant to 42 U.S.C. 12101 and in accordance with N.J.A.C. 6A:32-6.2.
* Pass the state required Mantoux Intradermal Tuberculin Test as required by N.J.A.C. 6A:32-6.3.

Meet such alternatives to the above qualifications as the CEO finds appropriate and acceptable.

**Requirements/Environmental Conditions:**

The physical demands and work environment factors described below are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

* Requires prolonged sitting or standing
* Occasionally requires physical exertion to manually move, lift, carry, pull, or push objects or materials.
* Requires the ability to work in noisy and crowded environments.
* Occasionally requires stooping, bending, or reaching.
* Requires some traveling.

**Essential Performance Responsibilities** (The following description is illustrative of tasks and responsibilities. It is not meant to be all inclusive of every task or responsibility.)

The English Language Arts teacher:

* Administers English education curriculum consistent with school district goals and objectives.
* Promotes a classroom environment that is safe and conducive to individualized and small group instruction, and student learning.
* Develops lesson plans and instructional materials and translates lesson plans into learning experiences to develop pertinent sequential assignments, challenge students, and best utilize the available time for instruction.
* Teaches knowledge and skills in English grammar and syntax, sentence and paragraph structure, composition, vocabulary and proper word usage, word denotations and connotations, creative writing, independent thinking, communication and speaking.
* Develops standards for critical analysis through group discussions on a variety of reading materials, including the mass media, and a wide range of literature.
* Works with students and others to prepare materials for inclusion in literary publications, contests, etc.
* Conducts ongoing assessment of student learning and progress, and modifies instructional methods to fit individual student's needs, including students with special needs.
* Maintains familiarity with district and New Jersey State standardized tests for the purpose of adapting curriculum to maximize student achievement on such tests.
* Continues to acquire professional knowledge and learn of current developments in the educational field by attending seminars, workshops or professional meetings, or by conducting research.
* Organizes and maintains a system for accurate and complete record-keeping, grading, and reporting for all student activities, achievement and attendance as required by district procedures and applicable laws.
* Encourages parental involvement in students’ education and ensures effective communication with students and parents.
* Ensures that student conduct conforms to the school's standards and school district policies, and establishes and maintains standards of student behavior needed to achieve a functional learning atmosphere in the classroom.
* Coordinates with other professional staff members, especially within grade level, and participates in faculty meetings and committees.
* Selects and requisitions appropriate books, instructional aids and other supplies and equipment and maintains inventory records.

Performs other related tasks as assigned by the School Director and other central office administrators as designated by the Superintendent.

**Note:** The above description is illustrative of tasks and responsibilities. It is not meant to be all inclusive of every task or responsibility.

**Qualifications Profile**

* Must hold a NJ Certification with Subject Matter Specialization: Language Arts or Teacher of English.

**Education**

* Bachelors from an accredited college or university in education discipline applicable to teaching assignments.
* Masters’ Degree preferred.

**Experience** Successful prior teaching experience for the appropriate grade level preferred.

**Equipment**: Uses standard office equipment such as personal computers, printer, copy and fax machines, and telephone.

**Travel Requirements:** Travels to school district buildings and professional meetings as required.

**Physical and Mental Demands, Work Hazards** Works in standard office and school building environments.

**Note:** Also see the Summary of Physical, Sensory and Environmental Requirements Needed to Perform Essential Functions for this position.

**Evaluation:** Performance of this job will be evaluated in accordance with New Jersey state law (Title 18A) and the iLearn Schools Inc. board policies and procedures.

**Supervise:** Students

title: Store Manager
description:
Job Overview:  
We are seeking a highly motivated and experienced Store Manager to oversee the daily operations of our retail store. The Store Manager will be responsible for ensuring excellent customer service, managing inventory, supervising staff, and driving sales.

Duties:  
- Develop and implement strategies to achieve sales targets and increase profitability  
- Monitor and analyze sales trends, customer behavior, and market competition  
- Create and maintain a positive shopping experience for customers  
- Train, develop, and supervise store staff to ensure high-quality customer service  
- Conduct performance evaluations and provide feedback to employees  
- Manage inventory levels and ensure accurate stock replenishment  
- Handle cash handling procedures, including opening and closing registers  
- Oversee store merchandising and ensure products are displayed attractively  
- Maintain cleanliness and organization of the store  
- Handle customer inquiries, complaints, and resolve any issues promptly  
- Collaborate with corporate teams on marketing initiatives and promotions

Experience:  
- Proven experience as a Store Manager or similar role in a retail environment  
- Strong organizational and leadership skills  
- Excellent communication and interpersonal skills  
- Proficient in cash handling procedures  
- Experience in interviewing, hiring, training, and developing employees  
- Ability to effectively manage shift schedules and allocate resources accordingly  
- Knowledge of administrative tasks such as scheduling, payroll, and inventory management

If you are a results-oriented individual with a passion for retail and have the skills necessary to lead a team to success, we encourage you to apply for the position of Store Manager.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $17.00 - $25.00 per hour

Expected hours: 35 – 40 per week

title: Sales Associate
description:
Are you looking to join an exciting work environment with the opportunity to earn high commissions and help our guests feel beautiful? Come get your strut on


and join our European Wax Center family!


European Wax Center is currently seeking Guest Service Associates to join our amazing team! If you have experience in sales and customer service, are upbeat, well-spoken and looking for a great career opportunity, this may be the place for you! As a member of our team, you will:

* *Have fun and build meaningful relationships with your team*
* *Create financial freedom for yourself & your family with our generous commission structure*
* *Enjoy a flexible schedule*
* *Be given the opportunity to grow with of one of the top franchises in the nation*


RESPONSIBILITES:


* Explains the benefits of regular waxing to all prospective guest utilizing our Wax Pass Saving Plans. Must maintain corporate standard for wax pass sales.
* Well versed in Sales and Objection Handling
* Exceptional customer service and multi-tasking skills
* Daily management of the reservation book through a software platform
* Keeps the center organized, well maintained, and clean at all times.
* A professional demeanor at all times
* A team player mentality
* Flexible, open availability
* The ability to work in a fun, fast paced environment.
* A goal oriented, driven mentality


BENEFITS:

* Paid training provided for the right candidate.
* Competitive pay that consists of: bi-weekly, no cap, commission and an hourly base
* Health, Dental, and Vision Benefits for full time associates
* 401K Planning
* Paid sick time off
* PTO on your birthday!!
* Employee of the month program
* Complimentary, unlimited, eyebrow waxing + discounts on all other waxing services and retail products
* Career growth opportunities (assistant manager, center manager, regional trainer, regional manager)
* A fun, well-managed, successful work environment


About European Wax Center


European Wax Center, Inc. is the largest and fastest-growing franchisor & operator of out-of-home waxing services in the United States providing guests with an unparalleled, professional personal care experience administered by highly trained wax specialists within the privacy of clean, individual waxing suites. European Wax Center, Inc. continues to revolutionize the waxing industry with their innovative Comfort Wax® formulated with the highest quality ingredients to make waxing a more efficient and relatively painless experience. Delivering a


360-degree guest experience, they also offer a collection of proprietary products to help enhance & extend waxing results. Founded in 2004, European Wax Center, Inc. is headquartered in Plano, Texas. Its network includes 944 centers in 45 states as of December 31, 2022. For more information about EWC, visit: http://www.waxcenter.com/careers.

*We are an equal opportunity employer and considers all qualified applicants equally without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran status, or disability status.'*


European Wax Center began as a family-owned business. Since 2004, we've provided our guests with a first-class waxing experience centering around:
  

* Our proprietary Comfort Wax®
* Private waxing suites
* A crisp, clean environment
* And the most professionally trained estheticians in the industry


From day one, we've been putting our values into action to delight our guests with an exceptional waxing experience.
Pay: $14.13 - $25 / hour

title: Insurance Sales - Commercial Lines
description:
#### **Job Description**


Are you looking for an opportunity that allows you to grow? Are you searching for a career that challenges you on a daily basis? Are you tired of being held back when you know you could be doing so much more? Do you wish you were part of a team and company that respects and supports each other? This position offers all of the above and will allow you to thrive IF you have the drive to do so. In the ever-changing world of insurance, there is never a dull moment. There is opportunity to learn something new every day. It is an exciting time to be a part of this industry, so apply now!


About us.


We are a family run agency that has been in business since 1881 and is currently operated by the fifth generation of the Stults family. With that longevity comes loyalty and trust within the company. We are dedicated to providing personalized service to our clients, as they are our top priority. Community involvement is also important to our company. Many of our staff take an active part in civic, charitable, and philanthropic activities as we recognize the significance of giving back. In addition to our service to clients and the community, we remain a strong presence within the insurance industry. We are committed to staff education and encourage our staff to keep up to date on the ever-changing industry trends. We respect and trust our employees and consider them part of the family. This position will allow the ideal candidate to thrive, as long as they put in the effort. Skies the limit!


Salary: $50000.00 - $90000.00 per year

 **Benefits**
Annual Base Salary + Commission


Paid Time Off (PTO)


Health Insurance


Vision Insurance


Life Insurance


Disability Insurance


Hands on Training


Mon-Fri Schedule


Career Growth Opportunities


Retirement Plan


Evenings Off

 **Responsibilities**  

PROSPECT & NETWORK: Grow customer base and meet sales goals by generating new business through phone solicitation, in-person prospecting, mailings, referrals, and networking.


RESEARCH: Online research and investigation of prospect businesses.


RELATIONSHIP BUILDING & ANALYSIS: Meet with prospective clients (on-site and off-site) to learn about their business and review their particular needs in order to determine the extent of coverage requirements.


COUNSEL & ASSIST: Counsel prospects and assist them in completion of applications, ensuring that all risks and exposures are represented.


QUOTE & PRESENT: Quote prospect businesses on various insurance company sites. Present proposals and final quotes to prospects, prior to closing sale.


DELEGATE: Connect insureds with assigned Account Representatives, while still maintaining contact when needed.


ADVISE: Assist existing clients with audits, policy changes, and coverage questions when requested.


CONTINUING EDUCATION: Once obtained, maintain insurance license by attending continuing education courses.  



  

**Requirements**  

Growth mindset, positive attitude, and client-centric work ethic


Thrives on autonomy and in a high-volume environment


Proven track record in identifying prospects through demand generation channels and cold-calling


Strong verbal and written communications skills


Highly-organized and strong time management skills


Unshakeable demeanor and ability to "get past no"


Ability to network at all levels and influence decision making


Computer literate with experience in Microsoft Office Products


Business to Business sales experience in any industry is required. Experience in the insurance industry is a plus.


.Valid Property & Casualty license strongly recommended.

 **Company Description**  

We are a family run agency that has been in business since 1881 and is currently operated by the fourth and fifth generations. With that longevity comes loyalty and trust within the company. We are dedicated to providing personalized service to our clients, as they are our top priority. Community involvement is also important to our company. Many of our staff take an active part in civic, charitable, and philanthropic activities as we recognize the significance of giving back. In addition to our service to clients and community, we remain a strong presence within the insurance industry. We are committed to staff education and encourage our staff to keep up to date on the ever changing industry trends.

title: Salesforce Developer
description:
Salesforce Developer


**Requisition ID:** 47101
**Business Unit:** Fitch Group
**Category:** Information Technology
**Location:**New York, NY, US
**Date Posted:** Sep 10, 2024
**Salesforce Developer**  


**Fitch Group is currently seeking a Salesforce developer to join our Business Applications team, based out of New York office. This role is within a high performing Salesforce development team, working closely with business applications leadership, business decision makers, and end users. This individual must have the ability to configure/ customize Salesforce to meet the business need.**  


**What We Offer:**
**Career Advancement Opportunities:** We provide substantial opportunities for career growth and professional advancement within our organization, enabling team members to achieve their career goals.
**Access to Cutting-Edge Technology:** Employees will have access to the latest technology and tools, ensuring they can perform their duties efficiently and remain at the forefront of industry advancements.
**Innovation and Evolution:** Team members will have the ability to contribute to the ongoing evolution and innovation of Fitch Technology's working methodologies, promoting a culture of continuous improvement and forward-thinking.
**Collaborative Culture:** We maintain an open and collaborative atmosphere where new ideas are welcomed and encouraged, fostering a creative and inclusive work environment.  


**We’ll Count on You To:**
**Problem Solving:** Troubleshoot, diagnose, and recommend solutions to complex business and technical problems, ensuring optimal functionality and efficiency.
**CI/CD Release Management:** Manage Continuous Integration/Continuous Deployment (CI/CD) release processes to ensure seamless and efficient software delivery.
**Requirement Mapping:** Map business requirements to Salesforce features and functionality, ensuring alignment with organizational goals.
**Technology Trend Monitoring:** Stay up to date with Salesforce Technology to ensure the reference architecture remains current and effective.  


**What You Need to Have:**
**Salesforce Experience:** Minimum of 2 years of hands-on experience with Salesforce.
**Salesforce Lightning Expertise:** Proficient in Salesforce Lightning and Lightning Web Component development.
**Version Control and CI/CD:** Experienced with version control systems and Continuous Integration/Continuous Deployment (CI/CD) release management.
**Agile/Scrum Methodology:** Experienced in working within an agile/scrum development process.
**APEX Proficiency:** Skilled in APEX triggers, classes, batch processes, and test methods.
**API Knowledge:** Proficient in REST API, SOAP API, and platform events.
**Communication and Team Skills:** Excellent communication skills, a strong team player, and a self-starter.  


**What Would Make You Stand Out:**
***Certification***
* Salesforce Admin certification
* Platform Developer I certification preferred.



**Why Fitch?**  


At Fitch Group, the combined power of our global perspectives is what differentiates us. Our global network of colleagues comes together to accomplish things greater than they ever could alone.  

Every team member is essential to our business and each perspective is critical to our success. We embrace a diverse culture that encourages a free exchange of ideas, guaranteeing your voice will be heard and your work will have an impact, regardless of seniority.
We are building incredible things at Fitch and we invite you to join us on our journey.  


Fitch Group is a global leader in financial information services with operations in more than 30 countries. Wholly owned by the Hearst Corporation, we are comprised of three main businesses: Fitch Ratings | Fitch Solutions | Fitch Learning.  

For more information please visit our websites  


  

For more information please visit our websites  


Fitch is committed to providing global securities markets with objective, timely, independent and forward-looking credit opinions. To protect Fitch’s credibility and reputation, our employees must take every precaution to avoid conflicts of interests or any appearance of a conflict of interest. Should you be successful in the recruitment process at Fitch Ratings you will be asked to declare any securities holdings and other potential conflicts prior to commencing employment. If you, or your immediate family, have any holdings that may conflict with your work responsibilities, you may be asked to divest yourself of them before beginning work.  


Fitch Group is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, national origin, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, protected veteran status, and other statuses protected by law.  


**FOR NEW YORK ROLES ONLY:** Expected base pay salary range for this role is $95,000 - $100,000 per year. Actual salaries will be determined on an individualized basis and may vary based on factors including but not limited to education, training, experience, past performance, and other job-related factors. Base pay is one part of Fitch’s total compensation package, which, depending on the position, may also include commission earnings, discretionary bonuses, long-term incentives, and other benefits sponsored by Fitch.

title: Head of Wealth & Investment Management Mortgage
description:
**About this role:**  

  

Wells Fargo is seeking a Head of WIM Mortgage with full business management and leadership responsibilities for this strategic growth area  

  

**Key Responsibilities:*** Execute WIM's overall mortgage strategy including enhancing the client experience, supporting business growth, and providing risk oversight with measurable business outcomes and client benefits
* Provide leadership to develop and implement strategic solutions and product results to ensure prudent credit decisions and a seamless mortgage experience for the WIM client, advisor and banker
* Manage an organization that includes a WIM Mortgage Underwriting team of manager(s) and underwriters in roles with moderate to high credit complexity and risk, and a WIM product management team dedicated to executing mortgage programs and initiatives
* Provide vision and direction for multiple high-impact priorities including strategic growth initiatives, high net worth and ultra-high net worth mortgage underwriting policies, client experience and segment pricing enhancements, and risk-related deliverables
* Engage and collaborate with key stakeholders, internal partners, and peers associated with WIM mortgages or who are affected by its outcomes, including the Home Lending and Risk teams
* Identify and recommend opportunities for process improvement and risk and control development within Wealth Mortgage functions and through collaboration with Home Lending
* Manage allocation of people and financial resources for WIM Mortgage teams including ongoing leadership for domestic and offshore staff to ensure commitments are met and align with strategic objectives
* Develop and guide a culture of talent development to meet business objectives and strategy
* Engage and influence WIM and Home Lending business leaders, control management, risk, legal, and audit partners to successfully ensure appropriate management of business risk.

**Required Qualifications:*** 8+ years of Product Management experience, or equivalent demonstrated through one or a combination of the following: work experience, training, military experience, education
* 4+ years of Management experience

**Additional Preferred Qualifications:*** 10+ years of wealth mortgage product and/or business management and mortgage underwriting experience or equivalent demonstrated through one or a combination of the following: work experience, training, military experience, or education
* 5+ years of team management experience
* Wealth business leadership and mortgage underwriting experience in a large, complex financial organization strongly preferred
* Demonstrated ability as a thought leader in mortgage strategy, underwriting, and business initiative execution for high net worth and ultra-high net worth segments
+ Strong background in credit risk and mortgage operations, and in effectively collaborating with cross-functional teams including finance, risk, legal, and compliance
+ Custom commercial and consumer credit experience

**Pay Range**  

  

Reflected is the base pay range offered for this position. Pay may vary depending on factors including but not limited to achievements, skills, experience, or work location. The range listed is just one component of the compensation package offered to candidates.  

$207,900.00 - $431,900.00  

**Benefits**  

  

Wells Fargo provides eligible employees with a comprehensive set of benefits, many of which are listed below. Visit Benefits - Wells Fargo Jobs for an overview of the following benefit plans and programs offered to employees.* Health benefits
* 401(k) Plan
* Paid time off
* Disability benefits
* Life insurance, critical illness insurance, and accident insurance
* Parental leave
* Critical caregiving leave
* Discounts and savings
* Commuter benefits
* Tuition reimbursement
* Scholarships for dependent children
* Adoption reimbursement

**Posting End Date:**  

16 Sep 2024  

* **Job posting may come down early due to volume of applicants.**

  

**We Value Diversity**  

  

At Wells Fargo, we believe in diversity, equity and inclusion in the workplace; accordingly, we welcome applications for employment from all qualified candidates, regardless of race, color, gender, national origin, religion, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information, individuals with disabilities, pregnancy, marital status, status as a protected veteran or any other status protected by applicable law.  

  

Employees support our focus on building strong customer relationships balanced with a strong risk mitigating and compliance-driven culture which firmly establishes those disciplines as critical to the success of our customers and company. They are accountable for execution of all applicable risk programs (Credit, Market, Financial Crimes, Operational, Regulatory Compliance), which includes effectively following and adhering to applicable Wells Fargo policies and procedures, appropriately fulfilling risk and compliance obligations, timely and effective escalation and remediation of issues, and making sound risk decisions. There is emphasis on proactive monitoring, governance, risk identification and escalation, as well as making sound risk decisions commensurate with the business unit's risk appetite and all risk and compliance program requirements.  

  

Candidates applying to job openings posted in US: All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, status as a protected veteran, or any other legally protected characteristic.  

  

**Applicants with Disabilities**  

  

To request a medical accommodation during the application or interview process, visit Disability Inclusion at Wells Fargo .  

  

**Drug and Alcohol Policy**  

  

Wells Fargo maintains a drug free workplace. Please see our Drug and Alcohol Policy to learn more.

title: Lead Control Management Officer
description:
**Why Wells Fargo:**  

  

This is where your true career begins. We ranked #3 on the 2022 LinkedIn Top Companies list - and #1 among financial services companies - as the best workplace "to grow your career" in the U.S. At Wells Fargo, we support employees' career aspirations and growth. We're proud of our employee-welfare-centered business approach and our commitment to diversity, equity, and inclusion in the workplace. We offer competitive salaries and one of the richest benefits packages in the industry. Our Total Rewards program focuses on wellness, work-life balance and the financial health of our employees. Our customers invest with us, we invest in you. Apply today.  

  

At Wells Fargo, we are looking for talented people who will put our customers at the center of everything we do. We are seeking candidates who embrace diversity, equity and inclusion in a workplace where everyone feels valued and inspired. Help us build a better Wells Fargo. It all begins with outstanding talent. It all begins with you.  

  

Learn more about the career areas and lines of business at wellsfargojobs.com
  

  

**About this role:**  

  

Wells Fargo is seeking a Lead Control Management Officer in the Global Operations Control Organization as part of the Commercial Banking Operations team.  

  

**In this role, you will:*** Own and independently manage 2-3 complex Risk Assessable Units (RAUs), also knows as RCSAs, holding the pen in drafting
* Responsible for risk identification, risk measures, control identification/design and ratings applicable to the assigned RAUs in partnership with the RAU Owner within the business
* Manage all risk management activities association to the RAU (i.e.issues, OREs, process change, etc.) to ensure control requirements are met and adhered too by the business owner
* Become the risk and control subject matter expertise on the service models assigned and underlying L4 processes
* Provide risk management consulting to support the business in designing and implementing risk-mitigation strategies
* Collaborate with relevant business group to identify current and emerging risks associated with business activities and operations, and provide guidance in developing and implementing risk-mitigating strategies
* Integrate yourself in all necessary business routines to ensure your knowledge of the processes is sufficient
* Monitor assigned portfolio of control activities and escalate when necessary

  

**Required Qualifications:*** 5+ years of Risk Management or Control Management experience, or equivalent demonstrated through one or a combination of the following: work experience, training, military experience, education

**Desired Qualifications:*** Direct experience executing the RCSA (risk identification, risk assessment - inherent/residual, and control design)
* Direct experience with Issue Management Life Cycle and issue remediation
* Prior Commercial Banking experience
* Exceptional verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills
* Outstanding problem solving and analytical skills with the ability to turn findings into strategic solutions
* Ability to engage and partner with peers, managers, and experienced leaders across multiple risk stripes and lines of business
* Ability to make timely and independent judgment decisions while working in a fast-paced and results- driven environment
* Advanced Microsoft Office skills, including Outlook, Excel, Word, and PowerPoint

title: Banquet Server
description:
**Position:** Banquet Server

**Location:** Timber Point Country Club (Great River, NY)

**Qualifications:**

-Hospitality experience preferred.

-Must be willing to relate cordially with other members of the team and help co-workers with their job duties.

-Must have basic knowledge of service standards, guest relations, food and beverage preparations as well as etiquette.

**Job Duties & Responsibilities:**

-Provide assistance to banquet managers in the serving of guests during banquet functions to ensure positive guest experience.

-Set up banquet room as requested by the supervisor to include glassware, service ware, and linen.

-Attend roll call meetings before events start in order to learn function particulars, including hotel and guest expectations.

-Greet and welcome guests and respond to their requests in a courteous and friendly manner.

-Serve the beverage and food in the appropriate order and in tune with the expectation of the supervisor so as to ensure consistency throughout the banquet.

-Quickly remove dishes as guests finish each meal at the end of each meal or function.

-Abide by all corporate act, laws and requirements pertaining to serving alcoholic beverages.

-Replenish beverages when necessary, and check with guests to make sure they are satisfied.

-After the banquet, reset banquet room in accordance with the supervisor’s specifications to ensure the readiness of the room for other functions.

-Follow attendance rules and always go to work on a regular basis.

-Perform other related functions that may be assigned.

**Pay & Perks:**

-Hourly pay (plus tips)

-Paid Time Off for Full Time Employees

-401K for Full Time Employees

-Medical, Dental, Vision Benefits for Full-Time Employees

**The Company:** The Company:

Lessing’s Hospitality Group is comprised of over 100 locations throughout the Northeast and Florida. Lessing’s operates 20 wedding and catering venues, 20 full-service restaurants, 2 pop-up kitchen concepts, over 60 corporate and academic dining centers, and a historic inn. title: Security Guard
company: Little Sisters of the Poor (Queen of Peace Residence)
description:
**JOB OBJECTIVE:**

The Little Sisters of the Poor, Queen of Peace Residence, is looking for a Security Guard who will be responsible for the security of the Queen of Peace Residence (the ‘Home’) premises. The required responsibilities and duties outlined are consistent with the Home’s policies, procedures, as well as standard compliance with all regulation codes that govern the facility.

**JOB STANDARDS:**

* Must be a High School graduate or possess the equivalency of diploma.
* Must have a valid Security Guard License as determined by NY State Division of Licensing.
* Minimum of one year security experience preferred.
* Possess basic knowledge of Safety, Fire, and Emergency procedures.
* Must be able to speak, read, write, and understand the English language.
* Must be able to identify and communicate potential problems related to the safety and security of the Home (both the interior and exterior).
* Available to work in the event of an emergency under diverse conditions.
* Must be in good health, having functional mobility and physical strength to safely perform the essential job functions without reasonable accommodations.
* Effectively interact as a team member within assigned Department and with all department personnel.

**JOB RESPONSIBILITIES AND DUTIES:**

1. Maintain interior and exterior knowledge of the Home’s premises.

2. Efficiently monitor the Home’s premises hourlyby vertical tours of each floor to ensure all areas are secure and hazard free.

3. Monitor the Home’s CCTV for any unusual or suspicious activity or potential wanderer. Report and/ or document findings to assigned Supervisor immediately.

4. Follow all policy and procedures in the following areas: safety, security, exposure control, and hazardous waste.

5. Maintain thorough knowledge/ understanding of fire drill and security procedures. Possess the ability to use sound judgement in emergency situations and contact appropriate authorities and personnel.

***The Little Sisters of the Poor, Inc, provide SUPERIOR QUALITY CARE to the elderly poor in the US and throughout the WORLD! (Please visit our website: www.littlesistersofthepoor.org)****.*  ***Become part of something unique and special!***

As a religious order of Catholic nuns, the Sisters share their mission of hospitality and love with all their Residents and their Staff, who also share in their mission.

Job Type: Part-time

* Referral program

title: Educational Director – Manhattan Campus
description:
L’Alliance New York is a multi-disciplinary educational and cultural organization with locations in midtown Manhattan and Montclair, NJ. As an independent, not-for-profit organization, L’Alliance New York is committed to providing our audience and students with engaging French language classes and audacious multi-disciplinary programming that celebrates the diversity of francophone cultures and creativity around the world. We are a welcoming and inclusive community for all ages and all backgrounds, where people can meet, learn, and explore the richness of our heritages and share discoveries. We strive to amplify voices and build bridges from the entire francophone world to New York and beyond. L’Alliance New York has an extensive Language Center offering hundreds of French classes for all ages, a French Library, and year-round cultural programs ranging from cinema and performing arts to visual arts and social event programs.



L’Alliance New York is an American, private, not-for-profit 501(c)(3), non-governmental organization incorporated in the state of New York.


  
**Job Title:** Educational Director  

**Department:** L’Alliance New York Language Center  

**Reports to:** Preschool Director  

**Designation**: Exempt / Full Time  

**Salary:** $65,000.00 – $70,000.00 per year



—


*L’Alliance New York is a multi-disciplinary educational and cultural organization with locations in midtown Manhattan and Montclair, NJ. As an independent, not-for-profit organization, L’Alliance New York is committed to providing our audience and students with engaging French language classes and audacious multi-disciplinary programming that celebrates the diversity of francophone cultures and creativity around the world. We are a welcoming and inclusive community for all ages and all backgrounds, where people can meet, learn, and explore the richness of our heritages and share discoveries. We strive to amplify voices and build bridges from the entire francophone world to New York and beyond. L’Alliance New York has an extensive Language Center offering hundreds of French classes for all ages, a French Library, and year-round cultural programs ranging from cinema and performing arts to visual arts and social event programs.*


*The L’Alliance New York Language Center is the largest language school dedicated to teaching the French language in the tri-state area, with more than 8,000 registrations annually.*


**Position Summary**



L’Alliance New York is looking for a full-time **New York State-certified Educational Director** for its preschool, an immersion French program designed for toddlers and preschoolers (ages 2.5 to 4.5).  

The Educational Director will be responsible for helping with planning and implementing developmentally appropriate activities while promoting social, emotional, cognitive, and physical growth in toddlers and preschool-aged children. The working hours are 9:00 am-5:00 pm.


**Responsibilities**


* Serve as liaison between the administration and the teaching staff (two teachers and two assistants).
* Develop enrichment activities for the children (arts, music, gym etc.)
* Supervise children during lunch and recess.
* Organize and chaperone field trips.
* Ensure the physical safety of children through anticipation and removal of hazards, visual observation of children active or at rest, and by appropriately responding to potential injuries.
* Work in a team, share information, and build positive working relationships.
* Actively support the school’s philosophy and community and enforces its policies.
* Develop and supervise activities for the after-school programs.


The job description above is not an exhaustive list of duties. The person in this role will be expected to perform different tasks as necessitated by the role and the overall business objectives of L’Alliance New York.


**Qualifications/Requirements**


* Have a master’s in early childhood education.
* **Have NYS Teacher Certification.**
* Have at least two years of experience in a preschool.
* Be fluent in French.
* All candidates must be eligible to work in the U.S.
* Be fully vaccinated against COVID-19.


L’Alliance New York’s Preschool is located on the Upper East Side of Manhattan. Our mission is to provide a joyful entry into the French language and culture, combining the best of the *école* *maternelle* and American preschool experience to help each child reach his/her full potential.

  


**Benefits**


* Generous vacation package: you’ll have the same vacations as the preschool
* Excellent working environment
* Health Care, Dental, & Vision Plan
* 403(b) Savings Plan
* L’Alliance New York Membership

  


**TO APPLY**:



Please submit a cover letter, resume, and three references to the Human Resources department at careers@lallianceny.org.



PLEASE NOTE: Due to the large number of applicants we receive, we will only be able to contact those that we would like to meet for interviews.


*L’Alliance New York is an equal employment opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, creed, color, marital status, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, disability status, citizenship status protected veteran status or any other characteristic* *protected by law.*

title: Seasonal Sales Associate, UGG
description:
**Seasonal Sales Associate** 

**About UGG** 

At UGG, a division Deckers Brands, we exist to transform the lives of our customers and each other by sharing our passion and love for UGG. We’re driven by a clear mission: to bring the UGG brand to life through every interaction and evolve industry ideas by delivering experiences our customers desire. As a member of the Deckers Family, you represent our brands and deliver unique, personalized shopping experiences.

**Summary**

Our Sales Associates are critical to the success of our stores. As a Sales Associate, it’s your job to create the best possible customer experience. It’s your job to listen to each customer and offer recommendations and current product knowledge in response to their needs. You also know how to communicate the UGG brand’s sustainability initiatives and social and ethical commitments to our customers while sharing your love and passion for our products. As a Sales Associate, you operate as part of dynamic team and you cooperate to achieve business goals. This is a seasonal position, lasting for 2-5 months.

**Description**

As an UGG Sales Associate, you create personalized shopping experiences for our customers that drive brand loyalty. You understand the importance our modeling our Service Training Program and you greet customers promptly and courteously as they enter the store. You ensure that all customer questions are addressed accurately and responded to before they leave. You provide exceptional service from start to finish, including effectively communicating our return policy. You maintain a positive, cheerful attitude with customers and team members and promote the store and brand image in all interactions including adhering to a dress code. You provide exceptional customer service to both our in-store customers and those who call on the phone.

In your role as a Sales Associate, you understand that your role extends beyond the sales floor. You know how to operate the cash register, handle money accurately, check inventory daily and ensure products are stocked and available for customers, and merchandize product in accordance with Visual Merchandising standards. You also maintain a clean and well-organized back-stock area and employee break area, which includes daily vacuuming, sweeping, and dusting. You practice safety-consciousness and respond to theft in accordance with our policies. As an UGG Sales Associate you understand that you are an integral part of a team; you report to work on time and notify your Store Manager in advance if you will be late or absent.

**Core Competencies**

As a successful Sales Associate, you know how to:

* Ensure the highest level of customer service possible as outlined in our Service Training Program
* Prioritize brand and product knowledge training in customer interactions
* Communicate effectively with customers, team members, management, and corporate stakeholders
* Contribute to a team and cooperate to achieve goals
* Multi-task in a fast-paced environment
* Respond to problem situations with professionalism
* Think critically to solve problems and approach challenges with agility

**Key Qualifications**

* Two (2) years of retail store experience preferred.
* High School Diploma
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills and ability to convey the UGG and Deckers Brands Vision and Mission to your team members and customers
* Highly motivated team player and self-starter

**Additional Requirements** 

* Flexibility of schedule and hours to meet the needs of the business.
* Proficient in Microsoft Office suite of tools and applications.
* Valid driver’s license.

As part of our UGG Family, you belong to more than a lifestyle company. From our corporate offices to our retail stores across the globe, we value giving people the freedom to pursue their passions, express their individuality, and are committed to helping them succeed. We’re proud to offer a wide range of benefits to best recognize the important role each person plays in the Deckers Brands mission. In addition to competitive base pay, we offer a Holiday Incentive Bonus to all hourly employees in North America. You’ll discover many benefits of working at Deckers Brands including competitive pay, discounts, perks, global contests, as well as opportunities for growth and development.

**Equal Employment Opportunity** 

**All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without discrimination on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, disability, or any other factors prohibited by law.**

Job Types: Part-time, Temporary

Pay: $18.00 per hour

Benefits:

* Employee discount

Shift:

* 8 hour shift
* Day shift
* Evening shift
* Night shift

Work Location: In person

title: Spare Parts Coordinator
description:
We are a Squad on a mission to redefine timekeeping since 1884. Crafting watches that excel from air to land and sea, we embrace a unique blend of casual, sustainable, and inclusive luxury. Celebrating 140 years of history, with over 1900 passionate people over 20 countries, we're seeking exceptional talent to join our Squad.

**Position Summary:** The Spare Parts Coordinator is responsible for maintaining a highly accurate and detailed inventory and dispatch of all watch components, ensuring the seamless flow of parts to support the repair process. This role involves managing a large inventory, timely allocation of parts to in-house repairs and watchmaker requests and generating weekly purchase orders to replenish stock and receipt of repairs from sub-contractors. The coordinator must efficiently track back-ordered parts to ensure timely completion of repairs and assist with daily and weekly inventory transfers, cycle counts, and audits. The role is key to maintaining operational efficiency within the repair facility by ensuring all parts are available and accurately managed to meet tight repair deadlines.

**Essential Duties and Responsibilities** include the following. Other duties may be assigned.

* Maintain an accurate and detailed inventory of all parts for watches.
* Timely and meticulous allocation of parts to in-house repairs as well as watchmaker requests.
* Generate a weekly purchase order from distributor, including but not limited to all depleted parts and unavailable parts.
* Time management of jobs with back ordered parts, ensuring all parts are ordered to assist the workshop in delivering on a tight deadline.
* Accept daily and weekly transfer orders, ensuring the correct volume of a specific part was received and quickly determining its usage.
* Assist in weekly cycle counting and all inventory audits.
* Prepares transfers of attachments for all repair sites
* Responsible for the organization of the vault
* Performs weekly cycle inventory counts
* Must maintain excellent working relationships with the workshop and with the sales department
* Maintain service site for current stock
* Maintain an accurate customer repair database, ensuring all information is entered correctly and timely
* Coordinate with Repair Center Manager, Watchmakers and Spare Parts Coordinator to ensure limited turnaround time of repair, checking due dates, backorders, special promises, warranty obligations, and comebacks
* Assist in the physical flow of the repair cycle
* Assist in completing inventory counts at scheduled times throughout the year
* Ability to file repairs numerically, photocopying, scanning, correspondence, and other administrative duties as requested

**Education and/or Experience Required:**

* Minimum of a high school diploma or equivalent is required
* 1-2 years of administrative experience
* Ability to maintain excellent working relationships
* Ability to maintain the cleanliness of the workroom area
* Ability to pay close attention to detail and maintain precise data entry
* Previous experience using an ERP & SAP system is a plus
* Ability to clearly and timely communication via email and phone regarding repair status to coworkers and clients
* Must be able to lift 20-40 lbs

**Skills, Knowledge and Experience:-**

* Self-motivated and well organized
* Attention to detail
* Understanding of customer expectations / requirements
* Able to manage targets and deadlines
* Excellent motivational and communication skills
* Able to work in a team environment
* Pro-active problem solving
* Basic computer skills
* Knowledge of Breitling’s products, policies and procedures

Physical Demands: While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to sit; use hands to hold, handle, or feel; reach with hands and arms; and talk and hear. The employee is occasionally required to stand; walk; climb or balance; and stoop, kneel, or crouch. The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 20 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, and ability to adjust focus. The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

Breitling is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, race, color, creed, religion, ethnicity, national origin, citizenship, disability, marital status, military status, pregnancy or any other legally-recognized protected basis prohibited by applicable law.

Job Type: Full-time

Application Question(s):

* What are your salary expectations?
* Were your referred this position by an existing Breitling employee? If so, please state the name of the current employee

Ability to Commute:

* Wilton, CT 06897 (Required)

Ability to Relocate:

* Wilton, CT 06897: Relocate before starting work (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Analyst/ Associate - Equity Sales
description:
**Job Description:**

### **Business** **Overview:**


The Bank of America Equity Sales team leverages the firm’s top rated research platform to interact with the Institutional Client base: capturing mind share, delivering alpha and enhancing flows across all equity-linked products. The salesforce is the integral part of the platform, connecting Portfolio Managers, Analysts, Traders and everyone in between with the various product groups across BofAML Equities. We work closely with our partners in Trading/Sales Trading, Financing, Capital Markets, Derivatives and Corporate Access to maximize firm-to-firm connectivity and drive revenues. While working with the Equity Sales desk, you can expect to gain an understanding of our core capabilities:

* Idea generation / content creation around: Single stock ideas, Global Macro, Derivatives and Cross Asset
* Corporate Access: Connect CEOs, CFOs and other management from corporates around the globe with our client base. Sit in on meetings with Investors as they gain insights directly from the top management
* Capital Markets: Partner with Corporates to raise capital via Primary and Secondary offerings
* Daily interaction with research analysts, gaining insights on sector themes and best ideas
* Direct connectivity with key decision makers at the largest investment institutions in the world

### **Product/Desk****Overview:**

* The Equity Sales desk manages distribution of product across the institutional client base.

### **Associate****Roles****and****Responsibilities:**

* We are looking for outgoing individuals possessing strong interpersonal skills, quantitative and problem solving capability and hard workers. Candidates must possess a high level of communication skills, have a desire to learn about the markets and be a team player.
* Daily and weekly tasks will be assigned, additionally you will be asked to join client conference calls and morning research meetings. You will be asked to support the sales force in client coverage: such as idea generation, research dissemination and trading color.
* Other responsibilities include:
	+ Construct an investment idea which will be presented to the salesforce at the end of the rotation.
	+ Work with the analysts on the desk to identify content/events which will resonate with clients.
	+ Synthesize trading flow, research content, macro insights & positioning data to formulate market views.

### **Expectations and****Desired****Skill****Set****:**

* Desire to learn global markets and industry themes
* Basic analytical capability to articulate price targets / valuations
* Ability to work in a team environment + multi task

**Shift:**


1st shift (United States of America)**Hours Per Week:**


40

title: Wealth Management Client Associate
description:
**Job Description:**


At Bank of America, we are guided by a common purpose to help make financial lives better through the power of every connection. Responsible Growth is how we run our company and how we deliver for our clients, teammates, communities and shareholders every day.


One of the keys to driving Responsible Growth is being a great place to work for our teammates around the world. We’re devoted to being a diverse and inclusive workplace for everyone. We hire individuals with a broad range of backgrounds and experiences and invest heavily in our teammates and their families by offering competitive benefits to support their physical, emotional, and financial well-being.


Bank of America believes both in the importance of working together and offering flexibility to our employees. We use a multi-faceted approach for flexibility, depending on the various roles in our organization.


Working at Bank of America will give you a great career with opportunities to learn, grow and make an impact, along with the power to make a difference. Join us!

Key responsibilities include supporting enterprise strategic objectives, operational excellence goals, and client advocacy within the FA's business, while customizing solutions based on their specific needs. * Ensures timeliness, accuracy, and completeness in client materials and follows up on all client and Financial Advisor (FA) requests
* Assists with ensuring practices are in alignment with the bank's policies and procedures to support operational excellence, protect the bank's clients, and manage risk
* Identifies, deepens, and maintains client relationships through emphasizing the bank's offerings and promoting incorporation of banking into day-to-day practices, while communicating outputs to the FA
* Supports day-to-day team activities and needs including covering roles in times of absence or seasonal need increases, while leading with a client first mindset

title: QA Inspector
description:
We are looking for an experienced QA Inspector to join our Company, a fast-growing nutraceutical and dietary supplements developer and manufacturer.

The ideal candidate is sharp, a quick learner, and they should have pharmaceutical industry experience in Dietary supplement and food safety experience. They must demonstrate the ability to communicate clearly and effectively and thrive in highly dynamic and fast-paced environment.

**Responsibilities:**

* Responsible for ensuring compliance with cGMP and company policies, procedures and specifications.
* Responsible for performing in-process inspections, batch record review, and quality system functions in accordance with cGMP and related company SOP’s, state, federal and local laws applicable.
* To monitor, perform and document sampling/testing and inspection of raw material/components/in-process samples Labeling Components and documents the results in compliance with cGMP and company procedures.
* Write and review SOPs.
* To perform Line QA duties.
* Preparation of all written reports, recording all information accurately and at required intervals.
* Coordination with QC lab & production personnel & take care of all reports in a timely manner related to materials, products, incidents, deviations, CAPA etc.
* To assist in Customer Audits, Any Agency Audits and or internal audit & review on a timely basis.
* To assist in Product Complaints/ Recalls/Mock Recalls.
* Other responsibilities as assigned by executive management

**Qualification:**

* Associate Degree or Bachelor of Science preferably in Pharmacy, Chemistry or related field.
* Or Pharmaceutical QA or related experience

**Skills and Abilities:**

* Knowledge of basic or commonly used rules, procedures and operations related to nutraceutical and/or OTC regulations.
* Thorough understanding of Pharmaceutical Quality Assurance concept, including the ability to identify and resolve compliance issues.
* Ability to create documentation to use as a future standard.
* 2 to 3 years working experience in the relevant QA environment.
* Ability to predict and conform to change, as necessary.
* Independent Decision maker, Ability to work in a fast phase.

**Physical Demands:**

* Required to reach with arms and use hands and fingers to handle or feel.
* Required to stoop, kneel, crouch, stand, bend, sit, talk, hear, and climb a ladder.
* The employee may lift and/or move up to 50 lbs or more.

**Work Environment:**

* Work in an office environment but also at very close proximity to heavy machinery in the warehouse and powders from products.
* May be in contact with Allergens (Milk, Eggs, Fish, Crustacean Shellfish. Tree Nuts, Peanuts, Wheat, and Soybeans).
* Potential to move between office and warehouse areas to complete job functions.

We offer a comprehensive benefit package including medical, dental, vision, and 401K with match.

If you are excited to join our company and take the next step in your career, click the apply now button to find out more.

Compliance with New York State Human Rights Pay Transparency Law, the hourly range for this position is $20-24hr. Please note that the salary information is a general guideline only. title: Corporate Medicaid Director
description:
**Job Title:** Corporate Medicaid Director  
**Location:** Skilled Rehab and Nursing Home

**Position Summary:**  
We are seeking an experienced and detail-oriented Corporate Medicaid Director to oversee all Medicaid-related operations for our skilled rehab and nursing home facilities. This role will be responsible for managing the Medicaid application and approval process, ensuring compliance with federal and state regulations, and maximizing Medicaid reimbursements. The ideal candidate will have extensive knowledge of Medicaid programs, with a strong emphasis on New York Medicaid, including experience working closely with HRA (Human Resources Administration) to secure approvals for Medicaid applications. The goal is to ensure high approval rates, quickly identify and resolve issues that could hinder the approval process, and maintain compliance with regulatory requirements.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* **Medicaid Application Management:**
* Oversee the entire Medicaid application and recertification process for residents, ensuring timely submission and high accuracy to maximize approval rates.
* Work closely with residents, families, and social workers to collect and review necessary documentation, ensuring all paperwork meets HRA and Medicaid requirements.
* Ensure prompt submission and processing of applications and follow up regularly on the status of pending applications.
* **Relationship Management with HRA and State Agencies:**
* Serve as the primary point of contact between the nursing home and the HRA, developing and maintaining strong relationships to facilitate faster application processing and issue resolution.
* Collaborate with HRA case workers, financial counselors, and state Medicaid representatives to streamline the approval process and ensure adherence to Medicaid eligibility guidelines.
* Proactively engage with regulatory bodies to stay updated on policy changes and communicate potential impacts on Medicaid operations.
* **Issue Identification and Resolution:**
* Monitor Medicaid applications for potential issues or discrepancies, such as incomplete information, outdated documents, or changes in resident eligibility.
* Identify and address barriers to approval, including income, asset, and transfer concerns, and work directly with HRA or other agencies to resolve complex eligibility issues.
* Analyze application denials and provide actionable recommendations to improve approval rates.
* **Compliance and Regulatory Oversight:**
* Ensure full compliance with Medicaid regulations and guidelines, including timely submission of reports, audits, and financial documentation required by state and federal entities.
* Conduct regular audits of Medicaid applications, processes, and approvals to identify areas for improvement.
* Keep leadership informed of any changes in Medicaid policies, HRA procedures, or eligibility criteria that may impact current or future residents.
* **Maximizing Medicaid Reimbursements:**
* Work with the facility’s finance and billing departments to maximize Medicaid reimbursements by ensuring residents' eligibility status is updated and approved.
* Collaborate with finance teams to develop strategies to improve payment processes and ensure timely billing of Medicaid-covered services.
* **Team Leadership and Training:**
* Provide leadership and guidance to Medicaid coordinators and other relevant staff across multiple facilities, ensuring they are well-versed in the Medicaid process and compliance standards.
* Organize training programs for staff to improve their understanding of Medicaid eligibility, application procedures, and strategies for improving approval rates.
* **Data Analysis and Reporting:**
* Maintain detailed records of all Medicaid applications, approvals, denials, and appeals to monitor trends and identify recurring issues.
* Generate and present regular reports on Medicaid operations, including application approval rates, issues encountered, and success rates, to executive management.
* Track financial impact of Medicaid applications on overall facility revenue, identifying opportunities to improve financial performance through Medicaid reimbursements.

**Qualifications:**

* Bachelor’s Degree in Health Administration, Business, or a related field; Master’s degree preferred.
* In-depth knowledge of Medicaid regulations, eligibility criteria, and the application process, particularly within the skilled nursing and rehabilitation sector.
* Experience working with the New York HRA (Human Resources Administration) and a proven track record of high approval rates for Medicaid applications.
* Strong understanding of financial, income, and asset requirements for Medicaid eligibility, including transfer of asset rules, trusts, and other legal considerations.
* Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to work effectively with residents, families, staff, and external agencies.
* Proficiency in Medicaid management systems and software, with strong organizational and data analysis skills.
* Ability to handle sensitive and confidential information with discretion and professionalism.

**To Apply:**  
Interested candidates should submit their resume and a cover letter outlining their experience with Medicaid applications and working with HRA to Admin@Fairviewrehab.com Please reference "Corporate Medicaid Director Application" in the subject line.

title: Community Director
description:
IMPORTANT APPLICATION INSTRUCTIONS:* Upload Resume or Curriculum Vitae for automatic population of information to the application.
* The contact information, work experience, and education listed on your Resume/CV will be parsed and input into your Montclair application.
* Review information and double-check all fields containing information that the system parsed – the software is intelligent, but you need to verify that the data is accurate.
* In the “My Experience” section, you will find a Resume/CV upload option where you can submit your cover letter and all other supporting documents.


Note: If you have an expansive CV, we recommend that you apply manually and only include the positions you have held in the last ten (10) years. You will then be able to attach your Resume/CV, as well as all other supporting documentation in the "My Experience" section of your application.
Job Description
SUMMARY:
Reporting to the Assistant Director of Residence Life, the Community Director is responsible for the management of housing communities ranging in size from 300-1000 residential students, and the supervision of 6-50+ undergraduate student workers in varying positions and may also supervise a graduate Assistant Community Director, The Community Director orchestrates activities that integrate the academic and social life of students. This is a live-in position that requires on-call duty responses during the evenings and weekends.
PRINCIPAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:* Supervises, schedules, evaluates, develops and directs the work of student employees within the assigned community, including: assist in development of pre-semester and in-service student staff training programs or events, and workshops for a variety of staff lines; supervises and evaluates student employees; manages the payroll process for student staff.
* Implements and maintains the reception desk and community office operations. This responsibility may be shared with an Assistant Community Director (ACD) depending on the community.
* Promotes academic and personal development of community members through implementation of a residential curriculum of programming and activities; provision of counseling, information, referrals; supporting and advising a strong and responsive hall government; and administration of student conduct process, and participation in collaborative retention and relationship building initiatives with campus stakeholders. Advises Residence Life student organization(s) as assigned.
* Administers residential facility(s) housing 140-1100 students, including: preparation and implementation of building opening and closing processes and check-in and check-out of residents; processes room changes appropriately; prepares reports in cooperation with student staff input, ensures staff coverage and building security during all times that facilities are occupied; and promotes positive working relationships with maintenance, custodial, and physical plant workers to maintain facility-related safety standards. Maintain contact and collaborate with the Capstone On-Campus Management Director of Facilities and Administration.
* Participates in a rotating on-call duty schedule and responds to emergency calls on a 24-hour basis.
* Serves as first line of response during emergencies and critical incidents, including maintenance and repair emergencies, to mitigate risks to student safety and implement associated protocols and reporting responsibilities effectively and efficiently. Emergencies of a particularly serious nature such as sexual assault, suicide or attempt, physical assault or emotional crises are to be reported immediately to the Executive Director of Residence Life.
* Assists the Assistant Director of Facilities, and the Assistant Director of Operations regarding facilities related matters, such as damage billing, vandalism, maintenance concerns, service requests, etc. Plan and review emergency plan/management with Capstone On-Campus Management team when appropriate.
* Promotes fire safety through programs, inspections, and scheduled fire drills.
* Coordinates consistent security measures in each building, including utilization of the entrance area card key systems and hardware, the facilitation of guest sign-in procedures, and the implementation of an educationally grounded crime prevention program.
* Participates in professional development opportunities, including departmental and campus-wide committees, presentation of programs at regional or larger conferences related to residence life and/or student development, and Cooperative programming with other departments.
* Assists in performing central office duties and procedures as assigned during winter break and summer sessions. Provides additional coverage responsibilities for busy weekends, semester openings and closing, open houses, accepted students’ days, homecoming, Red Hawk Frenzy, Hall Council meetings and other programs/events as required.
* Attends regularly scheduled Residence Life staff meetings, Student Development and Campus Life Division meetings, and other meetings as assigned.
* Meets regularly with the Assistant Director of Residence Life.
* Performs other duties as assigned.
* Management retains the right to add or change job duties at any time.


QUALIFICATIONS:
REQUIRED:* Master’s Degree from an accredited college or university in Student Personnel, Student Affairs or Higher Education Administration, or related field.
* Demonstrated understanding of issues facing college students.
* A valid driver’s license.
* This is a 12-month, live-in position.
* The Community Director position is an entry-level position intended to provide candidates with initial higher education Student Development work experience. Based on the needs of the University and employee performance, candidates should expect to fulfill this role for two to three years.


PREFERRED:* Experience as a student leader or graduate student developing residence hall communities, providing education and personal support for students through programming, responding to student concerns and behaviors, advising hall councils, facility and administrative management, and participation in department initiatives.


PROCEDURE FOR CANDIDACY
Applicants should include a resume and cover letter describing how their background, skills and education match the needs of the University. When applying, please take a moment to carefully read and follow the steps in the application instruction.

Residential Life/Heights

Culinaire is a drug free environment, EOE and E-Verify Employer.
